context: The Estonian word 'direktor' refers to the head or manager of an establishment, company, factory, school, or institution. It can also refer to a government official corresponding to a minister in some countries. The word is used with suffixes -i (indicating possession) and -it (for object form), and appears in compound words like 'ase-direktor' (deputy director), 'pea-direktor' (chief director), etc.
